name: Unilever
goal:
UNILEVER: BRANDS WITH PURPOSE

Unilever is an Anglo-Dutch company with strong roots in Europe. With a global turnover of €51 billion (2018), it is employing 161,000 people worldwide. In Europe, Unilever’s turnover is €12.1 billion.

As a leading, innovative, Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) company, Unilever employs more than 6,000 R&D professionals who are building its brands through innovation. Unilever invests around €1 billion in R&D each year, and holds a portfolio of more than 20,000 patents and patent applications.

Unilever’s mission is to double the size of its business while reducing the overall environmental impact of its products and business processes across the value chain.

Our brands

We meet everyday needs for nutrition, hygiene and personal care with brands that help people feel good, look good and get more out of life. With more than 400 brands spanning 13 categories of home, beauty&personal care and foods&refreshment products, we touch the lives of over 2.5 billion people every day – whether that's through feeling great because they've got shiny hair and a brilliant smile, keeping their homes fresh and clean, or by enjoying a great cup of tea, satisfying meal or healthy snack.

We've always believed in the power of our brands to improve the quality of people’s lives and in doing the right thing. As our business grows, so do our responsibilities. We recognise that global challenges such as climate change concern us all. Considering the wider impact of our actions is embedded in our values and is a fundamental part of who we are.

Our brand portfolio has made us leaders in every field in which we work. It ranges from much-loved world favourites including Lipton, Knorr, Dove and Omo, to trusted local brands such Grom and Suave.

Our Code of Business Principles

Our efforts are guided by our Code of Business Principles which sets the standards of behaviour we demand from all our employees. It also outlines our commitments to our stakeholders including consumers, customers, suppliers, employees, communities and the environment.

Please consult our internet site www.unilever.com for more information or https://www.unilever.com/sustainable-living/ for more details on the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan.
